title: [Large-Scale] Variance Theory-Based Instructional Design for Understanding Sampling Distributions

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic statistics (Central Limit Theorem, sampling concepts) and foundational research methodology knowledge
context.additional_context: Need to Enhance Practical Sampling Competencies for Social Science Data Analysis

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the difference between sampling distributions with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can quantitatively analyze the impact of sample size changes on sampling variability using simulation tools.
Learners can design a process for determining an appropriate sample size using real-world social survey data.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
